verses.verse: Woe <S%H1945><s%> to you that spoil <S%H7703><s%>, and you were not spoiled <S%H7703><s%>; and deal treacherously <S%H898><s%>, and they dealt not treacherously <S%H898><s%> with you when you shall cease <S%H8552><s%> to plunder <S%H7703><s%>, you shall be spoiled <S%H7703><s%>; and when you shall make a end <S%H5239><s%> to dealing treacherously <S%H898><s%>, they shall deal treacherously with you <S%H898><s%>.

O Lord <S%H3068><s%>, be gracious <S%H2603><s%> unto us <S%H6960><s%>; we have waited for you <S%H2220><s%>: be you our arm every morning <S%H1242><s%>, our salvation <S%H3444><s%> also in the time <S%H6256><s%> of trouble <S%H6869><s%>.
At the noise <S%H6963><s%> of the tumult <S%H1995><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> fled <S%H5074><s%>; at the lifting up <S%H7427><s%> of yourself the nations <S%H1471><s%> were scattered <S%H5310><s%>.

And your plunder <S%H7998><s%> shall be gathered <S%H622><s%> like the gathering <S%H625><s%> of the caterpillar <S%H2625><s%>: as the running to and forth <S%H4944><s%> of locusts <S%H1357><s%> shall he run upon them <S%H8264><s%>.

The Lord <S%H3068><s%> is exalted <S%H7682><s%>; for he dwells <S%H7931><s%> on high <S%H4791><s%>: he has filled <S%H4390><s%> Zion <S%H6726><s%> with judgment <S%H4941><s%> and righteousness <S%H6666><s%>.

And wisdom <S%H2451><s%> and knowledge <S%H1847><s%> shall be the stability <S%H530><s%> of your times <S%H6256><s%>, and strength <S%H2633><s%> of salvation <S%H3444><s%>: the fear <S%H3374><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> is his treasure <S%H214><s%>.
Behold <S%H691><s%>, their valiant ones shall cry <S%H6817><s%> outside <S%H2351><s%>: the ambassadors <S%H4397><s%> of peace <S%H7965><s%> shall weep <S%H1058><s%> bitterly <S%H4751><s%>.

The highways <S%H4546><s%> lie waste <S%H8074><s%>, the wayfaring man <S%H5674><s%> ceases <S%H7673><s%>: he has broken <S%H6565><s%> the covenant <S%H1285><s%>, he has despised <S%H3988><s%> the cities <S%H5892><s%>, he regards <S%H2803><s%> no man <S%H582><s%>.

The earth <S%H776><s%> mourns <S%H56><s%> and languishes <S%H535><s%>: Lebanon <S%H3844><s%> is ashamed <S%H2659><s%> and cut down <S%H7060><s%>: Sharon <S%H8289><s%> is like a wilderness <S%H6160><s%>; and Bashan <S%H1316><s%> and Carmel <S%H3760><s%> shake off their fruits <S%H5287><s%>.
Now will I rise <S%H6965><s%>, says <S%H559><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%>; now will I be exalted <S%H7426><s%>; now will I lift up myself <S%H5375><s%>.
You shall conceive <S%H2029><s%> chaff <S%H2842><s%>, you shall bring forth <S%H3205><s%> stubble <S%H7179><s%>: your breath <S%H7307><s%>, as fire <S%H784><s%>, shall devour you <S%H398><s%>.
And the people <S%H5971><s%> shall be as the burnings <S%H4955><s%> of lime <S%H7875><s%>: as thorns <S%H6975><s%> cut up <S%H3683><s%> shall they be burned <S%H3341><s%> in the fire <S%H784><s%>.
Hear <S%H8085><s%>, you that are far off <S%H7350><s%>, what I have done <S%H6213><s%>; and <S%H7138><s%>, you that are near, acknowledge <S%H3045><s%> my might <S%H1369><s%>.

The sinners <S%H2400><s%> in Zion <S%H6726><s%> are afraid <S%H6342><s%>; fearfulness <S%H7461><s%> has surprised <S%H270><s%> the hypocrites <S%H2611><s%>. Who among us shall live <S%H1481><s%> with the devouring <S%H398><s%> fire <S%H784><s%>? who among us shall live <S%H1481><s%> with everlasting <S%H5769><s%> burnings <S%H4168><s%>?

He that walks <S%H1980><s%> righteously <S%H6666><s%>, and speaks <S%H1696><s%> uprightly <S%H4339><s%>; he that despises <S%H3988><s%> the gain <S%H1215><s%> of oppressions <S%H4642><s%>, that shakes <S%H5287><s%> his hands <S%H3709><s%> from holding <S%H8551><s%> of bribes <S%H7810><s%>, that stops <S%H331><s%> his ears <S%H241><s%> from hearing <S%H8085><s%> of blood <S%H1818><s%>, and shuts <S%H6105><s%> his eyes <S%H5869><s%> from seeing <S%H7200><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%>;

He shall live <S%H7931><s%> on high <S%H4791><s%>: his place of defense <S%H4869><s%> shall be the forts <S%H4679><s%> of rocks <S%H5553><s%>: bread <S%H3899><s%> shall be given <S%H5414><s%> him <S%H4325><s%>; his waters shall be sure <S%H539><s%>.
Your eyes <S%H5869><s%> shall see <S%H2372><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> in his beauty <S%H3308><s%>: they shall behold <S%H7200><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> that is very far off <S%H4801><s%>.

Your heart <S%H3820><s%> shall meditate <S%H1897><s%> terror <S%H367><s%>. Where is the scribe <S%H5608><s%>? where is the receiver <S%H8254><s%>? where is he that counted <S%H5608><s%> the towers <S%H4026><s%>?

You shall not see <S%H7200><s%> a fierce <S%H3267><s%> people <S%H5971><s%>, a people <S%H5971><s%> of a deeper <S%H6012><s%> speech <S%H8193><s%> than you can perceive <S%H8085><s%>; of a stammering <S%H3932><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%>, that you can not understand <S%H998><s%>.

Look <S%H2372><s%> upon Zion <S%H6726><s%>, the city <S%H7151><s%> of our solemnities <S%H4150><s%>: your eyes <S%H5869><s%> shall see <S%H7200><s%> Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> a quiet <S%H7600><s%> habitation <S%H5116><s%>, a tabernacle <S%H168><s%> that shall not be taken down <S%H6813><s%>; not one of the stakes <S%H3489><s%> there shall ever <S%H5331><s%> be removed <S%H5265><s%>, neither shall any of the cords <S%H2256><s%> there be broken <S%H5423><s%>.

But there the glorious <S%H117><s%> Lord <S%H3068><s%> will be unto us a place <S%H4725><s%> of broad <S%H7342><s%> rivers <S%H5104><s%> and streams <S%H2975><s%>; where shall go <S%H3212><s%> no <S%H1077><s%> galley <S%H590><s%> with oars <S%H7885><s%>, neither shall gallant <S%H117><s%> boat <S%H6716><s%> pass thereby <S%H5674><s%>.
For the Lord <S%H3068><s%> is our judge <S%H8199><s%>, the Lord <S%H3068><s%> is our lawgiver <S%H2710><s%>, the Lord <S%H3068><s%> is our king <S%H4428><s%>; he will save us <S%H3467><s%>.

Your riggings <S%H2256><s%> are loosened <S%H5203><s%>; they could not well <S%H3653><s%> strengthen <S%H2388><s%> their mast <S%H8650><s%>, they could not spread <S%H6566><s%> the sail <S%H5251><s%>: then is the prey <S%H5706><s%> of a great <S%H4766><s%> plunder <S%H7998><s%> divided <S%H2505><s%>; the lame <S%H6455><s%> take <S%H962><s%> the prey <S%H957><s%>.

And the inhabitant <S%H7934><s%> shall not say <S%H559><s%>, I am sick <S%H2470><s%>: the people <S%H5971><s%> that live <S%H3427><s%> in it shall be forgiven <S%H5375><s%> their iniquity <S%H5771><s%>.
